author: TRexroat
post_text: January 24, 2017 at 9:10 PM#1Hey guys,Just curious if there's a syntax option to boot other consoles off the session via IP address. I often times will have a console/workstation online in my dimmer pit. I usually assign that console the IP address 192.168.0.10, while my primary is x.1, and my backup is x.2.Wondering if I can remotely kick that IP address off from my master console?Thanks in advance,T-Rex

posts.author: TRexroat
posts.post_text: January 24, 2017 at 9:10 PM#1Hey guys,Just curious if there's a syntax option to boot other consoles off the session via IP address. I often times will have a console/workstation online in my dimmer pit. posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: January 25, 2017 at 1:34 AM#2[color=#66FF33]RemoteCommand[/color] 192.168.0.10 "LeaveSession"Might also just be able to do [color=#66FF33]LeaveSession[/color] 192.168.0.10, but I'm not sure about that one without testing.

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: January 25, 2017 at 8:01 AM#3I believe this should do the jobCodeDisconnectStation 192.168.0.10or merelyCodeDS 10
